oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Unidentified Drouillard child in a sailor suit, between 1885 and 1904
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A cabinet card portrait photograph of an unidentified Drouillard child (male) pictured in a sailor suit, between 1885 and 1904. While it is unknown which Drouillard this is, the young man is probably a direct descendant of the Civil War veteran Captain James Pierre Drouillard (1839-1892) and Mary Florence Kirkman Drouillard (1843-1905). The Drouillard family resided in Dickson County, Tennessee for many years and subsequently in Nashville, Tennessee. A logo on the verso: "Poole Art Company, Corner Cherry & Union Sts., Nashville, Tenn." And: "negative no. 39128." Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 cabinet card photograph : sepia ; 4.25 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Drouillard family
